headlines.description: — Music blared from the Chicago Bears locker room after a victory for the first time in almost a year, and players danced and jumped around with joy.
headlines.shortLinkText: Fields and Moore lead the Bears to their first win of the season, beating the Commanders 40-20

headlines.description: — Whenever Josh Allen and the Buffalo Bills tried to rally in the fourth quarter on Sunday, Travis Etienne and the Jacksonville Jaguars had an answer.
headlines.shortLinkText: Etienne runs for 2 TDs and Jaguars beat Bills 25-20 for back-to-back London wins

headlines.description: — All the talk from Atlanta coach Arthur Smith the last two years about Desmond Ridder's poise and composure meant little until the quarterback demonstrated he could shine in the final minute with a game on the line.
headlines.shortLinkText: Desmond Ridder answers critics, Younghoe Koo kicks last-second field goal, Falcons edge Texans 21-19

headlines.description: — The Detroit Lions were without arguably their best player and a dynamic rookie on offense.
headlines.shortLinkText: Jared Goff throws 3 TD passes, runs for score, NFC North-leading Lions beat winless Panthers 42-24

headlines.description: — Indianapolis Colts running back Zack Moss heard the talk all week.
headlines.shortLinkText: Moss upstages Taylor's return in Colts' 23-16 victory over Titans. Richardson injures shoulder

events.name: New York Giants at Miami Dolphins

headlines.description: — De’Von Achane’s teammates are learning to brace for a big play each time the rookie running back touches the ball.
headlines.shortLinkText: De'Von Achane and Tyreek Hill lead Miami Dolphins to 31-16 win over New York Giants

events.name: New Orleans Saints at New England Patriots

headlines.description: — Alvin Kamara told the Saints coaching staff he wanted to touch the football more this week.
headlines.shortLinkText: Kamara becomes Saints' career TD leader, Carr throws 2 TDs in 34-0 rout over Patriots

headlines.description: — Mike Tomlin spent a portion of the week showing the Pittsburgh Steelers clips of their longtime rivalry with the Baltimore Ravens.
headlines.shortLinkText: Pickett hits Pickens for late touchdown as Steelers rally to stun mistake-prone Ravens 17-10

events.name: Philadelphia Eagles at Los Angeles Rams

headlines.description: — Philadelphia went 74 yards in 30 seconds and lined up at the Rams 1 for one final snap before halftime. Just about everybody in SoFi Stadium knew that last play would be the “tush push,” the “Brotherly Shove," or whatever Jalen Hurts' secret name is...
headlines.shortLinkText: Jalen Hurts and a tough defense carry the Eagles to a 23-14 victory over the Rams

headlines.description: — Zac Taylor said he spent much of Sunday's game on the headset with his fellow Cincinnati Bengals coaches, hollering at quarterback Joe Burrow to quit scrambling for a few extra yards and throw the ball away on plays that looked dead.
headlines.shortLinkText: Burrow connects with Chase for 3 TDs; Bengals roll past the Cardinals 34-20

events.name: New York Jets at Denver Broncos

headlines.description: — For once, Nathaniel Hackett relished Russell Wilson's mistakes and basked in the boos raining down from the stands in Denver.
headlines.shortLinkText: Jets rally past Broncos 31-21 with long TD from Breece Hall and scoop-and-score from Bryce Hall

events.name: Kansas City Chiefs at Minnesota Vikings

headlines.description: — Though Patrick Mahomes and the defending Super Bowl champion Kansas City Chiefs have had plenty of scares already, they've lost just one game, by one point.
headlines.shortLinkText: Patrick Mahomes, Chiefs outlast Vikings 27-20; Travis Kelce catches TD pass after hurting ankle

headlines.description: — Brock Purdy and the San Francisco 49ers quickly turned the biggest challenge of their young season into a laugher.
headlines.shortLinkText: Brock Purdy throws 4 TD passes to lead the 49ers past the Cowboys 42-10

events.name: Green Bay Packers at Las Vegas Raiders

headlines.description: — Linebacker Robert Spillane had just one career interception before Monday night, and cornerback Amik Robertson received just his second start in five games this season.
headlines.shortLinkText: Raiders intercept Jordan Love 3 times, hold on to beat Packers 17-13
